fields.description:
In Confluence 5.10, and 6.2, new languages were added to Confluence. However, indexing support for those languages were not added and so instances generating content in those languages would not be able to index and search them properly. In 6.14.0 we added indexing support for a number of these languages but Polish was left out because of licensing issues which have since been resolved.


We will be using the Stempel analyzer from Lucene.
fields.summary: Add indexing support for Polish

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary

Confluence uses [C3P0|https://www.mchange.com/projects/c3p0/] as its database pooling layer, which provides tons of options for administrators who wish to tune the way their applications connect with their database through a JDBC Driver.

Among these options, there's one called {{hibernate.c3p0.min_size}}, which sets the minimum size that the database pool must have to operate throughout its lifecycle. Due to the way that Confluence handles its database pools, if this property is set to a non-zeroed value, the application may end up doubling the amount of database connections that the database will need to handle, which can cause performance issues and jeopardise resource planning.
h2. Issue Details

Confluence uses [Hibernate|http://hibernate.org/] as its ORM framework. Recently, Confluence has been bumped to Hibernate version 5, which is good, since new capabilities are added, but is also bad, given that the issue mentioned above happens.

The problem happens because during startup Hibernate is going to open parallel Database Connection Pool(s) to perform metadata queries and fulfil its own needs. This/these parallel Database Connection Pool(s) will use C3P0 as well to be configured. That being said, let's imagine the following setup:
{code:java}
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_size">60</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.min_size">30</property>
{code}
This implies that Confluence will raise a Database Connection Pool that will have 30 connections opened with the database since startup and that can grow up to 60 connections depending on need. In a nutshell, this means that, at anytime, we'll have at least 30 connections established with the database.

That being said, an administrator can then plan database capacity accordingly, given that the administrator knows that the maximum amount of connections that the database will need to handle is 60 connections. Right? *Wrong!* :)

From Hibernate 5 onwards (which is our current version), Hibernate will also open database pool(s) as mentioned above. This means that during startup, we can double the amount of connections being sent to the database. As two pools are opened, we can send _max_size_ times two to the database, meaning that 120 connections can be established. If an administrator planned to have his database being able to hold up to 60 connections maximum, a bottleneck is established as the pool can grow bigger than what the database can handle.

Aside from that, Confluence will never close the parallel pool(s) opened by Hibernate, which means that if _hibernate.c3p0.min_size_ has been set to a non-zeroed value, once Hibernate is done using its pool, 30 connections are going to remain established with the database but are never going to be used, given that it is used only during startup.
h2. How to Validate Impact

Here's a step by step guide to check the bug behaviour on PostgreSQL:
 # Stop Confluence.
 # Edit <Confluence-Home-Directory>/confluence.cfg.xml and set the following properties as below:
{code:java}
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_size">60</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.min_size">60</property>
{code}
 # This is supposed to mean that the maximum number of connections that your pool can establish with the database is 60 connections.
 # Start Confluence.
 # Go to your database and run the following query once Confluence is up and running - Don't forget to replace your database name and database username in the query:
{code:sql}
select count (datid)
from pg_stat_activity
where datname = 'confluence_6.6.3' and usename = 'confluenceuser';
{code}
 # This query should not return values bigger than 60, as it brings the amount of JDBC connections established by C3P0 with the database. Once you run it, you are going to see more than 60 due to the bug mentioned herein. On a testing environment (clean instance), the count reached to 81.

h2. Workaround

The workaround is to go ahead and set _hibernate.c3p0.min_size_ as 0. This way, once Hibernate is done using its database pool, unused connections will be removed from the pool based on timeout until it has zeroed out. In a matter of a few minutes, pooled but unused connections should no longer exist and the database won't have connections without usage tied to it.
fields.summary: Setting c3p0.min_size to a non-zeroed value causes Confluence to trigger an overhead of Database Connections

fields.description:
h3. Bug Summary:

post-upgrade health-check throws false warning: The database collation '*en_US.utf8'* is not supported by Confluence. You need to use 'utf-8'.
h3. Environment:

Confluence 6.4 -> upgraded to 6.14.2, postgresql 9.6
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create postgres database with en_US.utf8 collation/cset:
{code:java}
CREATE DATABASE test_db with ENCODING 'UTF-8' LC_COLLATE 'en_US.utf8' LC_CTYPE 'en_US.utf8' TEMPLATE template0 OWNER postgres;
{code}

 # Create new Confluence environment (using the oldest supported version of the installer), use database created in previous step
 # Download latest Confluence installer file, proceed with upgrading existing environment
 # Start Confluence after the upgrade

h3. Expected results

Confluence starts without any issues
h3. Actual results

Following warning is displayed during the startup:
{code:java}
We discovered a problem while preparing to start Confluence. If you're a Confluence admin, you can either fix this problem now or ignore it, and start Confluence anyway.
Database: The database collation 'en_US.utf8' is not supported by Confluence. You need to use 'utf-8'.
{code}
h3. Notes

This occurs because the health check verifies against all {{utf-8}} collations, and does not include {{utf8}}. {{utf8}} is a supported collation, we are incorrectly reporting this as a failure.

h3. Workaround

If using Docker, the initdb args can be overridden by setting {{POSTGRES_INITDB_ARGS}} to the below as per the example (this is using Kitematic).

{code}
--encoding=UTF8 --lc-collate='en_US.UTF-8' --lc-ctype='en_US.UTF-8'
{code}

It is safe to ignore the health check failure now and continue - it will only appear on upgrade.
fields.summary: post-upgrade health-check throws false warning: The database collation 'en_US.utf8' is not supported by Confluence. You need to use 'utf-8'.

fields.description:
Add ETag support for those REST API calls that do not expand macros.

Use case:
 * We have pages that are reset to an updated state on a daily basis.
 * In the page history, we do not want to see the idempotent updates.
 * However, we want to overwrite edits made by others (persons or scripts); i.e. the script cannot skip the update if the source data has been changed.
We want to send an alert to the page maintainer if this happens.
 * Retrieving the data from Confluence to do an "is this unchanged" check before updating risks a race condition. Also, we want to avoid triggering a flurry of alerts whenever a Confluence update returns more or different information.
fields.summary: REST API: Add ETag support

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, system admin and space admin is able to set the category of space and also remove the category from the space. The customer would like to have the feature that restricts the space category feature for system admin only. They do not want the space admin to be able to add, edit or remove the space category for space.

h3. Suggestion
Provide an option to disable the space category option for non-system admin
fields.summary: Restrict the space categorize feature to system admin only

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

h4. Scenario 1

1. Create a page hierarchy like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page 1
** Child Page 2
** Child Page 3

2. Go to Browse > Pages and click on "Tree" and then use drag and drop to reorder the pages like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page 3
** Child Page 2
** Child Page 1

3. Remove Parent Page without removing child pages

4. Go to Browse > Pages. The ordering will be lost, and instead pages will be sorted alphabetically like this:
* Child Page 1
* Child Page 2
* Child Page 3

h4. Scenario 2

1. Create a page hierarchy like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page
*** Grandchild Page 1
*** Grandchild Page 2
*** Grandchild Page 3

2. Go to Browse > Pages and click on "Tree" and then use drag and drop to reorder the pages like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page
*** Grandchild Page 1
*** Grandchild Page 3
*** Grandchild Page 2

3. Remove Parent Page without removing child pages

4. Go to Browse > Pages. The order of the grandchild pages is reversed as follows.
* Child Page
** Grandchild Page 2
** Grandchild Page 3
** Grandchild Page 1

h3. Suggested Solution

In the both scenarios, the page order should be preserved after the parent page is removed.
fields.summary: Ordering of descendant pages should be preserved even when parent page is removed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

_Background_

_Confluence 6.15.1 shipped with a new functionality which allows to enable additional matching logic upon importing Spaces from Cloud. In future, Cloud will stop to export usernames and replace them with email addresses (or unique number identifiers) in Space export. These emails can be matched with users' emails set in Confluence Server. Learn more in this KB article: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Import+a+space+from+Confluence+Cloud]_

The email-matching process is enabled on the admin page Backup & Restore by checking the "Attribute content created in Confluence Cloud to matching users in this site (Cloud spaces only)" checkbox. If a User performs such Cloud import and forgets to set this checkbox, when they reimport again, having it set this time, such import would fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a Cloud Space export. Check if the entities.xml file contains email addresses stored in ConfluenceUserImpl->name fields.
 # Perform a Space import, do not check the "Attribute content ..."
 # Observe all the content has been attributed to "Unknown Users"
 # Delete the imported Space
 # Perform a Space import again, this time check the "Attribute content ..." checkbox.

h3. Expected Results

After second import, all of the content that had corresponding users in Server, should be properly attributed to them (e.g. properly display page creators, commenters, etc.)
h3. Actual Results

After second import, all of the content in imported Space remains attributed to Unknown Users.
h3. Workaround

To recover from such failed import, you must remove the unnecessary entries from the USER_MAPPING table.

To do that, only delete these which match an email address and are NOT usernames in the *cwd_user* table: 
 # Make sure the problematic Space is deleted
 # Execute the following query: 

|{{delete from user_mapping where username like }}{{'%@%'}} {{and username not in (select user_name from cwd_user);}}|
fields.summary: Performing a second Space import from Cloud, after not choosing email matching, fails.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description Users want to use message:// markup to open their client mail application. h4. Issue 1 Confluence already support some markups but not support message:// as can be seen in its source code: {code:java} private static final Pattern OFF_SITE_URL_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^\\s*(([a-zA-Z]*(?]])*(\\s)*"); {code} h4. Issue 2 When trying to use message:// markup with < or % (message://<... or message://%) as a workaround, Confluence page editor does not retain the link and remove it completely. These are the steps to replicate: # Install Confluence Source Editor plugin # Edit page and insert a new link message:⁨// (Ex: message://<01D6XSK9JR2C998T72TWMJYP2T@atlassian.com>) on the address field and press insert button. # Click on open in the source editor button (added by the plugin mentioned in step 1). # HTTP argument will not be there. # Still in edit mode click on the link created in step 1 option Go to the link to be redirected to the e-mail message (Please note that this message must be present on customer mail). # Click on the update button. # Click on the link created on step 1, and it didn't do anything. # Click on the edit link to see that Confluence removed the entire link message:// when the insert link button is clicked. As can be seen through Source Editor, Confluence removes the HREF from the frontend code when we insert a link with message:// markup as opposed to a regular link : {code}

Message


Message1

{code} *Suggestion* Confluence should have message:// markup available automatically in any page in order to create a link when users paste anything with this syntax: {code:java} message:// {code}
fields.summary: Message:// Markup Confluence Link

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Replicate
# Login into Confluence.
# Access *<Confluence_BASE_URL>/anytext/#all-updates*

h4. Expected Behaviour
The incorrect *<Confluence_BASE_URL>/anytext/#all-updates* URL will return a Page not found (404) response

h4. Actual Behaviour
The incorrect *<Confluence_BASE_URL>/anytext/#all-updates* URL will return the *All Updates* page with 200 OK

h4. Workaround
No known workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Confluence All Updates URL is accessible with incorrect URL path

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying Status macro within the same Page takes over a minute to complete
h3. Environment


 * Windows 10
 * Microsoft Edge 44.17763.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Page
# Insert a Status macro, choose a color and add some text
# Select and Copy the Macro
# Paste it anywhere in the same Page

h3. Expected Results

The Status macro is copied over instantly.

h3. Actual Results

the Page freezes and action takes over a minute to complete.

The following message pops up in the bottom of the Browser
{noformat}
Localhost is not responding due to a long-running script
{noformat}

h3. Notes

The same operations completes instantly in Chrome Browser.
Video demo: https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cqeFIo0Clx

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying Status Macro is very slow

fields.description:
Support for using more advanced queries (such as CQL) in page properties report macro to specify what pages to include.

For example:

I want to include pages with page properties:

prop1=value1 AND prop2 = value2 OR prop3 != value3
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro: add possiblity to specify more advanced queries (CQL)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a Confluence page, when a user clicks on the Spaces drop down menu at the header. The page scrolls up a little.

Eventually, the page title overwrites the line above, as can be seen here:

!Screen Shot 2019-09-19 at 22.06.15.png|width=443,height=225!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head over to a Confluence page
 # To see the issue better scroll down until you reach the middle of the page. 
 # Then head over to the Spaces drop down at the top header. 

h3. Expected Results

The page remains static
h3. Actual Results

The page is scrolled up a little and #space-menu-link-content is added to the URL and/or the page title overwrites the line above.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page automatically scrolls up a little when a user clicks on the Spaces menu dropdown at the header

fields.summary: Add support for Oracle 12c release 19 (12.2.0.3), 18  (12.2.0.2)

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Currently, when two users start editing a file via the Companion App, the user who saves last will overwrite any changes made by the user before them.

h4. Suggestion
# Provide a way to merge changes between versions or allow users to simultaneously edit the same version.

Issue is similar as the one raised for the older Edit with Office option.
* [CONFSERVER-52135 - Allow simultaneous edits to a single document version in the Office Connector|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52135]
fields.summary: Allow simultaneous edits to a single document version in Companion App

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Currently, when two users start editing a file via the Companion App, the user who saves last will overwrite any changes made by the user before them.

h4. Suggestion
# Show a pop-up when a user tries to edit a file via the Companion App, so that they're aware another user is editing the file, and the changes don't get overwritten.
fields.summary: Inform users that another user is actively editing an attachment via the Companion App

fields.description: The [Confluence Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220186/confluence-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] plugin is now supported for Confluence Server. Due to the demand for Slack integration with Confluence Data Center, it is best to verify the plugin for Data Center.
fields.summary: Support Confluence Server for Slack (Official) on Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "watch a few spaces" dialogue is triggered when a user logs into Confluence for the first time.

This is based on popular spaces, and can sometimes contain personal spaces.

As a result, users are watching the suggested personal space, furthering its popularity, which is undesirable in many cases.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to prevent personal spaces from being listed here, or block them altogether.

h3. Why this is important
Many customers don't need their users watching personal spaces, but the more relevant spaces.
fields.summary: Prevent "Watch a few spaces" dialogue from suggesting personal spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the macro shortcut "{" while an image is selected. The image will be converted into some parameter and the macro suggestion stop working and does not pop up the macro suggestion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Insert image on the page
# Click on the image (settings-popup for image appears)
# Enter macro shortcut "{" (image is converted to a text similar to this: "{ [Root Page > Current Page > selected_image_title.png]{")
# Place cursor in another location on the page
# Press "{" again -> the macro search popup does not appear
(i) For details, please review the following video.
 [^Recording #55.mp4] 


h3. Expected Results
The Macro Suggestion is still working

h3. Actual Results
The macro suggestion is not working

h3. Workaround
User another browser than FireFox or unselect the image when using the macro shortcut.
fields.summary: Macro shortcut stops working when image is selected (Firefox only)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Reorder Pages page (*Space Tools* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder pages*), the sort alphabetically button (icon) is not visible anymore. This issue occurs in Confluence 6.14.1 but possibly occurring in other versions as well.

The button was still visible when tested on Confluence 6.12.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head over to a space that has multiple pages.
 # Space Tools* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder pages*
 # Start reorder pages by dragging pages around.

h3. Expected Results

The sort alphabetically button is visible and clickable.

  !Screen_Shot_2019-03-13_at_9_38_36_PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The sort alphabetically button is not visible, however clicking the area where the button supposed to be will trigger the sort functionality.

  !Screen_Shot_2019-03-13_at_9_41_45_PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sort alphabetically button in the Reorder Pages page is not visible.

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# When we insert the *Contributors macro* in a new page, it will not show the contributors until the page is refreshed once.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page and insert the *Contributors macro*.
# Save the page, and the macro will show the message below.
** *No contributors found for: authors on selected page(s)*
# Refresh the page once, and the issue goes away.

h4. Current behavior
# Contributors macro does not show the contributors when inserted onto a new page, until the page is refreshed.

h4. Expected behavior
# Contributors macro should show the contributors on the first page save.
fields.summary: Contributors macro does not load on new page create until page is refreshed

fields.description:
Since version 6.14, new users joining the Confluence site will no longer be prompted to upload a profile picture or watch spaces when they first log in. ([CONFSERVER-40215|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40215])

While this could avoid confusion to a new user, but it also takes away the administrative power to ensure new users watch some important spaces in Confluence.

Instead of going into each space and watch them, it will be great if users can manage their watch lists straight from the space directory.

Example:
 !spacedirectory.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow space watching (or unwatch) straight from the space directory

fields.description:
Currently, there isn't a simple way to adjust the reputation thresholds for the Confluence Questions plugin (discussed in this documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/permissions-407724476.html#Permissions-RepBasedPermissions]). 

It would be great to expose a configuration option for this in the Questions administration UI to allow users to make this configuration site wide and by spaces.
fields.summary: Provide the Ability for to adjust the Questions Reputation Thresholds Via UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user has Confluence that integrates with JIRA 8, the user will not be able to add custom Jira dates from Jira in  JIRA Event in the team calendar. Team calendar will only provide the option to create JIRA event via the project and with the standard 3 files (Issue Due Date, Version Due Date, Sprints)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 8
 # Create a custom field Test with definition Date Picker
 # Create Application link with JIRA 8
 # Create simple Jira issue macro to enable Oauth for your user.
 # Install Team Calendar
 # Add a JIRA issue date event
 # Select Project where the issue is with field Test

h3. Expected Results
Field Test will be visible alongside with 3 standard fields Issue Due Date, Version Due Date, Sprints

h3. Actual Results
Only standard 3 fields are visible (Issue Due Date, Version Due Date, Sprints)

h3. Notes
This option worked in Jira 7.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: user cant pick custom Jira dates in JIRA issue dates event in Team calendar when integrating with JIRA 8

fields.description:
Each user can generate their personal access token for Confluence.

Atlassian Cloud and Bitbucket Server can generate a personal access token.
Need a same feature for Confluence.

To call the REST APIs, personal token is better by using from a program.
fields.summary: Generate a personal access token for Confluence

fields.description:

Opening Application Link Menu on a log-in page will display "Something went wrong, please try again".

Confluence 6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence Administration > Application Navigation create at least one link

Navigation will display your link

The error message is displayed with 401 error.

fields.description:
h3. Description.
When a blog post that contains a task with special characters or dates and was edited. Users will see a duplicate task created in the task view page. The issue does not affect when the task does not contain special characters.


*Step to reproduce*
# Create a new blog post in any space.
# In this blog post, assign a task which contains one or more special characters to a user, e.g.: [] @testuser: New task öäü!/();
# Publish the blog post.
# The new task should now show up in the user's task view (/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action) only once.
# Now edit the blog post by changing its page title, e.g. testblog01 -> testblog02
# Save the blog post
# There are now two or even more copies of the same task in the user's task view.
(i) For details, please review the following video
 [^Recording #53.mp4] 

*Expected result*
The task is not duplicated

*Actual Result*
Task is duplicated

*Workaround*
Admin can remove the duplicate task with the resolution provided in the following documentation.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/duplicate-tasks-appearing-in-my-tasks-or-task-reports-624525428.html
fields.summary: Task is duplicated in the task view page when user edited the blog that contains task with special characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Some users manage their teams and their roles on Confluence and would like to have a list of which users are assigned to a specific role in Jira, on each project.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Create a macro that lists the roles of a Jira project and which users are assigned to each role.

h3. Why this is important

* This makes it easier to manage which users should have a specific role on each project.
fields.summary: Create a Jira macro in Confluence that displays which users are assigned to a Jira project's role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting a link from search result in "insert link" dialog causes several problems depending on the Confluence version. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Page A
# Comment "foobar" on Page A
# Create Page B and edit 
# Summon "Insert link" dialog and search "foobar"
# You will find a result named "Re: Page A", then select and insert it 
 # Save the page

h3. Expected Results
Page B is created including a "Re: Page A" link to comment "foobar" 

h3. Actual Results

As far as I confirmed,  
* In 6.14.1
The link text was "Re: Page A" in the editor but it turns to "unnamed link" after saved.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-08 at 12.49.10.png|thumbnail! 
{code:none}
2019-03-08 03:48:32,632 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [plugins.rest.resources.BreadcrumbResource] generateBreadcrumbs Unsupported resource type: comment: Re: Page A v.1 (1245194)
 -- referer: http://<base-url>/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=LIN&fromPageId=1245191 | url: /rest/prototype/1/breadcrumb | traceId: c1d90c6d02c7f567 | userName: admin
{code}
* In 6.9.3
Page saving fails with an exception of resource identifier resolution.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-08 at 14.07.57.png|thumbnail! 
{code:none}
Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.model.resource.identifiers.CannotResolveResourceIdentifierException: Unable to resolve the resource identifier IdAndTypeResourceIdentifier[id=65603,type=comment]
{code}

h3. Workaround

Create a link to comment from Web Link following the instruction in [Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/links-776656293.html]
fields.summary: Inserting link to comment from search result doesn't work properly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when an issue is added to multiple Confluence pages using the *Jira Issue Macro*, a *Mentioned In* section is created on the Jira Issue page that showcases all other pages that reference the issue. However, there is no way to display this same information in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution

There should be additional Section or Field Name that can be added to the Jira Issue Macro that pulls other Confluence Pages that are also linking to the same Issue.

h3. Why this is important

This feature would help teams better track Jira issues and their corresponding Confluence pages, give users one place to go to see the current status and easily navigate to the documentation associated with each issue.
fields.summary: Add "Mentioned In" Section to Jira Issue Macro

2015-12-02 11:34:25,508 http-bio-8080-exec-21 anonymous 694x255x1 qalb93 192.168.1.10:53150,192.168.1.97 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'jirauser' has FAILED authentication. Failure count equals 2
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user on the internal directory with the same name as an LDAP user;
# Create a directory of type *Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication* with the "Copy user on login" option *unchecked*;
# Migrate users from the default *Internal Directory* to the Delegated one;
(i) Users can login successfully with LDAP password.
# Edit the Delegated directory to "Copy user on login";
(!) Problem occurs.

h3. Environment
* Able to reproduce with AD, but *not* with OpenLDAP;

h3. Workaround
(!) _This workaround involves manual manipulation of the JIRA's database, please perform any change on a test environment first before applying into production and make sure to have an up-to-date backup._
# Stop JIRA;
# Get the directory's ID;
{code:sql}
SELECT id AS "ID", directory_name AS "Name" FROM cwd_directory WHERE directory_type = DELEGATING;
{code}
# Remove the value for {{external_id}} of the migrated users directly on the {{cwd_user}} table in JIRA's database;
#* For MySQL and PostgreSQL
{code:sql}
UPDATE cwd_user SET external_id = '' WHERE directory_id = <directory-id>
{code}
#* For SQL Server:
{code:sql}
UPDATE cwd_user SET external_id = NULL WHERE directory_id = <directory-id>
{code}
# Restart JIRA;
fields.summary: Migrated users that already existed on LDAP directory are unable to login

h2. Problem Description

When using certain character combinations in the page, seen here with *\\\$* and the *Code Block macro*, when the page is saved and displayed these characters are expanded into span tags in the latest Firefox browser, see image below:

  !span-code-block.png|thumbnail!

When testing later versions e.g. 6.13.3 and 6.14 the issue was no longer observed.

 
h2. Workaround

No workaround is known.

Description of predefined role CONNECT, RESOURCE should be replaced in Oracle database setup guide

fields.description:
This suggestion is in relation to the Confluence & Jira integration with respect to Team Calendars. 

If the Jira system plugin _iCal_ is disabled, the user will not have all features of the integration and will not understand why that is. It would be ideal if we detected that the plugin was disabled on the Jira side and delivered this message to the admin so that they could address it.
fields.summary: Provide a better error message when iCalendar plugin is disabled in Team Calendars & Jira integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Confluence does not have the ability to real-time edit Excel Files. The file is still edited by Office Suite.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Provide the ability to live edit Office files.

h3. Why this is important   

* Some users would like to edit the Office files directly in Confluence instead of clicking on "Edit in Office" which will open the file in Excel(or Word).

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Real-time editing Excel files(or Word)

fields.description:
As a Confluence user, I would like to be able to restrict which events are in view for users to a *specific time span*. 


This restriction should not keep users from effectively editing or viewing the events. This should simply "grey out" the days that are not included in the time span.
fields.summary: Restrict Team Calendar event view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Questions for Confluence data is not found after clicking on a label from the Labels List macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and add some questions to it
# Add labels to the questions:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-06 at 12.40.22.png|thumbnail! 
# On a new page, add the Labels List macro
# Check that the labels from Questions for Confluence are listed in the macro:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-06 at 12.23.16.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on the Questions for Confluence labels

h3. Expected Results

Contents of Questions plugin are shown after clicking on its related label on the macro.

h3. Actual Results

Questions for Confluence plugin contents are not shown:

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-28 at 17.50.03.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

The Labels List macro does not seem to look for Questions for Confluence contents, even though it lists the label in the first place. This creates confusion and adds information to the macro that is not useful.

h3. Workaround

# To avoid confusion, manually exclude Questions for Confluence labels from the Labels List macro.
# For the Questions plugin labels, use the Questions List macro instead.
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence contents not displayed on Labels List results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira issue macro table filter will not display correct information if linked issues field is used and if data comes from two different Jira instances.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.9.0/6.6.6
Jira 7.9/7.8/7.11
Application link between all applications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira 1 create tickets TEST-1, TEST-2, TEST-3
# In Jira 2 create ticket SER-1
# In Jira 1 in ticket TEST-1 make an internal link to tickets  TEST-2, TEST-3, SER-1
# On Confluence page insert Jira issue macro as a table, 
## In filter use TEST-1
## In Display option add field "Linked Issues"
# Save the page and observe the results

h3. Expected Results
In the table, in column Linked Issues you will see all 3 linked tickets from issue TEST-1 (TEST-2, TEST-3, SER-1).

h3. Actual Results
Only ones coming from the same Jira will be visible (TEST-2, TEST-3).

h3. Notes
Problem is visible if we use Jira 2 and do the same test.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issue macro table filter will not display correct information if linked issues field is used and if data comes from two different Jira instances

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The section from the Confluence Global dashboard called "Recently Worked On" is not available as a macro.

Recently Updated does something similar but has the following issues:
# It's not possible to use "current user" as a variable (see [CONFSERVER-39299|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39299])
# It's not possible to display drafts

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to add Recently Worked On as a macro in a page

h3. Workaround 
Writing a User Macro may be help to work around this problem
fields.summary: Ability to use Recently Worked On from dashboard as a macro

fields.description:
This bug is created on behalf of a Community post:
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Unknown-Server-Error-in-Confluence-from-using-Atlassian-s-Space/qaq-p/1001852]
Another community post having a similar issue:
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Plugin-uninstall-destroys-Confluence/qaq-p/1019918#M135051]
h3. Issue Summary

When following the Confluence Space Blueprint tutorial, once you've created and applied your plugin. You're no longer able to create a Confluence Space.
h3. Environment

Reported on Confluence 6.7.1, 6.12.2, 6.14.0 using Postgres 9.6.

(Optional - If Applicable)
*
*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce:
 # Install the latest Atlassian SDK as per [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/install-the-atlassian-sdk-on-a-windows-system/]
 # Navigate to the instruction set for creating a space blueprint: [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/write-a-simple-confluence-space-blueprint/]
 # Clone the repository located in those instructions that contains the completed space blueprint plugin to a folder on your local machine:

git clone git@bitbucket.org:atlassian_tutorial/confluence-space-blueprint.git
 # Open a command prompt (on windows) and navigate to the folder that you cloned the repository into.
 # Build and run the plugin by typing the following command into the command prompt:
atlas-run
 # Open up a browser window and navigate to [http://localhost:1990/confluence/] (or whichever link you use to access the local instance of confluence you just started).
 # Login using admin/admin as username/password.
 # Click on the Confluence Administration cog wheel in the upper right hand corner, and then click "Manage Apps."
 # Click on "Upload App."
 # Navigate to the directory you cloned the repository into, and click on the "target" folder (if this folder doesn't exist, you need to run atlas-run).
 # Select the space-blueprint-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file and click "Upload."
 # Refresh the page, and select "Create space" under the Spaces dropdown. Note that the Example Space Blueprint is listed as an option, and you can successfully create a space if you wish to test that.
 # Go back to Confluence Administration->Manage Apps, and uninstall the plugin you just installed.
 # Refresh the page, and select "Create space" under the Spaces dropdown. Note that no error occurs.
 # Select the command prompt, and hit Ctrl-C to kill the server instance currently running (you may have to navigate to Task Manager and kill a process named "Java SE Platform Binary" in order to completely kill the server).
 # After the server has stopped, type the following command into the command prompt:
atlas-clean
 # Open pom.xml in your favorite text editor (or open as a project in IDEA or other IDE).
 # Change the confluence versions and data versions in the properties block from this (I also tried modifying my amps.version to 6.21, but it didn't fix anything):
<properties>
<confluence.version>6.7.1</confluence.version>
<confluence.data.version>6.7.1</confluence.data.version>
<amps.version>6.3.15</amps.version>
<plugin.testrunner.version>1.2.3</plugin.testrunner.version>
<atlassian.spring.scanner.version>1.2.13</atlassian.spring.scanner.version>
<!-- This key is used to keep the consistency between the key in atlassian-plugin.xml and the key to generate bundle. -->
<atlassian.plugin.key>${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}</atlassian.plugin.key>
<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
<maven.compiler.source>1.8</maven.compiler.source>
<maven.compiler.target>1.8</maven.compiler.target>
</properties>to this:
<properties>
<confluence.version>6.14.0</confluence.version>
<confluence.data.version>6.14.0</confluence.data.version>
<amps.version>6.3.15</amps.version>
<plugin.testrunner.version>1.2.3</plugin.testrunner.version>
<atlassian.spring.scanner.version>1.2.13</atlassian.spring.scanner.version>
<!-- This key is used to keep the consistency between the key in atlassian-plugin.xml and the key to generate bundle. -->
<atlassian.plugin.key>${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}</atlassian.plugin.key>
<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
<maven.compiler.source>1.8</maven.compiler.source>
<maven.compiler.target>1.8</maven.compiler.target>
</properties>
 # Repeat steps 4 through 13.
 # Refresh the page.
 # Click on "Create Space" under the Spaces tab, and note the "Unknown Server Error" message you receive.
 # In the command prompt, look at the log output. You should see an error like the following:
 [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2019-02-07 15:35:17,015 WARN [http-nio-1990-exec-8] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
 [INFO] [talledLocalContainer] ->[PluginReadWriteTx]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT (Session #1567347778)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Each page in Confluence has a unique PageID identifier that can be used as a unique reference to that specific page, however, pages cannot be searched by PageID

h3. Suggested Solution
All current pages should have their PageID value included in the index, this would be useful in cases where Confluence used as a KB system where each article needs to be easily identified by ID.
 
h3. Workaround
Although the pages can't be searched by ID, you can still access it with direct URL: http://confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=XXXX
fields.summary: PageID should be searchable

fields.description:
h3. Steps
 # Click Create new space button

Error. And modal dialog with infinite spinner that I cannot close and cannot click any link on the page.

In local instance, the error was:
{code:java}
We can't create that blueprint right now.

Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only{code}
In prod:

We can't create that blueprint right now.

Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; SQL []; ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255); nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255){code}
*What should have happened...*

New space obviously.

fields.description:

fields.description:
AS a user I want to be able to optionally include a file size attribute when adding the Attachments Macro to a page so that I can immediately see what size attachments are before downloading.

 
{quote}GIVEN I am an editing a Confluence page

WHEN I add an Attachments Macro

THEN I am given the option to include the file size as an attribute.
{quote}
 
{quote}GIVEN I am viewing a Confluence page using an Attachments Macro

WHEN the file size has been included in the macro parameters

THEN I can see a column identified as "File size"

AND the file size for each attachment is displayed in bytes, kilobytes or megabytes.
{quote}

fields.description:

Relates to CONFSERVER-1406 and [https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=DISC&title=Using+Confluence+for+professional+documentation]
fields.summary: {include} and {include-exerpt} macros should work for older versions of pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, only Space Administrators are allowed to delete Page or attachment version as outlined in [Delete or Restore a Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/delete-or-restore-a-page-139429.html].
This means that even if a user has a full Delete right for Pages or Attachments, they still can't delete versions of that same page.

h3. Suggested Solution
* If a user has Delete Page and Delete Attachments space Permissions, they should be allowed to delete a version of the page too.
* Alternatively, Adding an option to delete Versions could also be added into Space Permissions control page
 
h3. Workaround
There is no workaround, a user needs to be a Space Administrator as deleting page version is permanent and can not be recovered from trash like a deleted page is.
fields.summary: Users with Delete Page permissions should have rights to delete page versions

fields.description:
Regression of CONFSERVER-32468. 
Replicated on 6.12.2 and 6.14.1
{quote}We have an attachment called *Business Objectives.xls*, (attached), and when we try to display the content of the file using the Excel macro in a page titled *(3/5/14-4/29/15)*, it fails to render and instead throws the error below, (see the attached _screenshot XLS_bug.jpg_):

??Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : Unrecognized date string, please use mm/dd/yyyy??

Notice how the macro appears to be picking up the wrong page name, (see previously mentioned screenshot "_XLS_bug.jpg_"), when on the page titled *(3/5/14-4/29/15)* it becomes truncated to */5/14-4/29/15)*.

Embedding the same spreadsheet in a page with the title *Test XLS*, (or any other title which doesn't contain date like formatting), allows the content of the spreadsheet to be rendered normally, (see attached screenshot "_Working_example.jpg_"), and the naming convention of the file also appears to have no impact on the bug.

This issue is specific to pages which contain date-like formatting in their titles, for example the page title *(3/5/14-4/29/15)*.
{quote}
fields.summary: Office Excel macro:Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : Unrecognized date string, please use mm/dd/yyyy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After adding a new field to the Decision blueprint, that field is not editable until you publish the page and then choose to edit.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the administration console and edit select the option for *Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Edit the *Decision* blueprint
# Add a new row to the table and add any title to the row and add a new variable type (example - $dec-type)
# Save the blueprint
# Navigate to a space
# Create a new page using the *Decision* Blueprint

h3. You can edit all rows/text within the table
h3. The newly created cell that should house the variable is blank and is unable to be edited or added to


h3. Workaround
Publish the page, edit the page and the entire table should be able to be edited.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding files to a page with the Attachments Macro and using the Companion App to edit attached files, the macro displays "Uploaded from Companion app" on a line beneath the file name, as shown in the screenshot below: 
!attachments macro.png|thumbnail!

The text consumes unnecessary space in the macro, especially when numerous files are edited with the Companion App.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to hide this text in the Attachments Macro or remove it entirely. 

h3. Why this is important
If users edit numerous files using the Companion App, the Attachments Macro consumes more of the page to make room for the additional text. It makes it more difficult to navigate the file list, as users must scroll through a longer list of text. 

h3. Workaround 
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Hide the "Uploaded from Companion app" comment in the attachments macro for all files edited in the Companion App

fields.description:
{panel:title=This issue has been split into 2 suggestions}
Please read this comment for a detailed explanation. In summary:

If you are typing a *full word* (e.g. "manage" to match "manager") and find that your document does not match, you are likely interested in CONFSERVER-58280

If you are typing a *partial word* (e.g. "manag" to match manage) and find that your document does not match, you are likely interested CONFSERVER-58279
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

With Confluence 6.14, many improvements where made on search engine, making finding different words easier and faster. We don't need to type all the word to find results. Engine should give suggestions as we type. This was explained in [Search for anything|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-14-release-notes-963655609.html]
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.14.0 and 6.14.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple pages with the following titles: Management, Managers, Managerial.
 # Make suer the index was built
 # Search for "Manage"

h3. Expected Results

All 3 pages should be returned
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is returned
h3. Workaround

Add * at the end of word you are looking for. This is not ideal as it might return a lot noise.

Alternatively, copy the title of the page into the page body. Then search seems to return it fine.

Note that the site indexing language also needs to be set correctly for Confluence to stem words correctly. i.e. if you select "French" as your indexing language you cannot expect different versions of English words to match.
fields.summary: Search works only with exact words

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

Currently, Confluence only allows users to add a maximum of 3 sections in the Page Layout.

h3. Suggested Solution  

Add the ability to add more sections.
fields.summary: Allow users to add more than 3 sections in Page Layout

fields.description:
Currently the types available for input on a variable in a template include Text, Multi-Line Text and List.

I propose adding another type, which provides a calendar-style date picker. The calendar picker is already a feature in other areas of Atlassian products such as Jira when changing the Completion Date of an issue. This could be named Date.

We have an international team that has different date formats, so inserting in this form will prevent the usual month/day mix-up. The output could be in ISO 8601 i.e. 2019-02-28.

 

Thank you,

Nick
fields.summary: Date picker for variables in templates

fields.description:
There was a server-side template injection vulnerability in Confluence Server and Data Center, in the Widget Connector. An attacker is able to exploit this issue to achieve path traversal and remote code execution on systems that run a vulnerable version of Confluence Server or Data Center.

 

*Affected versions:*

All versions of Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center before version 6.6.12, from version 6.7.0 before 6.12.3 (the fixed version for 6.12.x), from version 6.13.0 before 6.13.3 (the fixed version for 6.13.x) and from version 6.14.0 before 6.14.2 (the fixed version for 6.14.x).

 

*Fix:*
 * Confluence Server version 6.15.1 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].
 * Confluence Server version 6.14.2 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.13.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.12.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.6.12 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].

 

For additional details, see the full advisory: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+-+2019-03-20]
fields.summary: Remote code execution via Widget Connector macro - CVE-2019-3396

fields.description: Pages created from blueprints leave behind a "create.blueprint.page.draft.request" entry in the os_property table after they're published.  These may contain small amounts of PII so it's important to delete them.

fields.description:
There was an SSRF vulnerability in Confluence Server and Data Center in the WebDAV plugin. A remote attacker is able to exploit this issue to send arbitrary HTTP and WebDAV requests from a Confluence Server instance.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center before version 6.6.7, from version 6.7.0 before 6.8.5 (the fixed version for 6.8.x), from version 6.9.0 before 6.9.3 (the fixed version for 6.9.x).

 

*Fix:*
 * Confluence Server version 6.15.1 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].
 * Confluence Server version 6.14.2 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.13.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.12.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * Confluence Server version 6.6.12 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].

 

For additional details, see the full advisory: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+-+2019-03-20]
fields.summary: SSRF via WebDAV endpoint - CVE-2019-3395

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After migrating from Cloud to Server, the "x Jira links" button does not appear on the header of existing pages that do contain Jira links.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.14.1
* Jira 8.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence+Jira website in Cloud.
 # Create a project and two issues in Jira.
 # Create a page in Confluence and link the two issues on it.
 # Backup both sites.
 # Restore the Confluence backup in a Confluence Server 6.14.1 instance.
 # Restore the Jira backup in a Jira Server 8.0.1 instance.
 # Create an application link between the Server applications
 # Go to the page and click "Login & Approve" if requested.

h3. Expected Results

The header of the page loads a button saying "2 Jira links".

h3. Actual Results

The button is not loaded at all.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 3.36.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

# Create a copy of the page. The copy will work, but the original one won't.
# (Optional) Delete the original page.
# (Optional) Rename the copy with the original name.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 3.34.47 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: After migrating from Cloud to Server, the "x Jira links" button does not appear on existing pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By clicking on *Dashboard* in the top breadcrumbs menu from a page in Confluence, it does not take you to [the Confluence Dashboard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-dashboard-139374.html], but rather the view of all pages in the space, the same menu you can reach by clicking *Pages* in the sidebar.

!spacehomepage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Confluence Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space in Confluence.
# From a page in this space, click *Dashboard* at the top in the breadcrumbs menu
# Note you will see one of the two images, depending on how many additional pages you have added to the space:

!pagesview1.png|thumbnail!  !pagesview2.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
By clicking *Dashboard* I would expect to be taken to the Dashboard.
 !dashboard.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Actual Results
By clicking *Dashboard*, you are instead brought to *Pages*.

h3. Notes
Note that in the possibility that it's expected behavior to navigate to *Pages* when clicking on the head breadcrumb, a name change of that link might be needed so there is no confusion.

h3. Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Clicking Dashboard in Breadcrumbs Navigates to Pages and not Dashboard.

fields.description:
If you create the [unproxied application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-create-an-unproxied-application-link-719095740.html] in Confluence, the *Whitelist* entry for Jira will display the *Display URL* while it is actually pointing to the *Application URL* that the request is coming from.

Confluence administrator had to add a new entry with the same *Display URL* to resolve the issue accessing the link in the page header as it is rendered by the *jira-metadata* plugin that is going through the whitelisted *Application URL*. This causes the *Whitelist* to print the *Display URL* twice and cause confusion to the administrator who maintain the instance.

Therefore, it is best to display the correct *whitelisted Application URL* instead of *Display URL* when we create the [unproxied application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-create-an-unproxied-application-link-719095740.html] in Confluence.

8/23 Update:
To clarify the workaround: add another Whitelist rule for <display URL>/* with a Type of _Wildcard expression_.
fields.summary: Display Application URL in the Whitelist if the Application link is configured with different Display and Application URL (unproxied)

fields.description:
In Data Center, most heavily used caches have default size limit of 25,000. Due to a typo, Hibernate query cache is set to have just 1000 maximum entries. This might increase pressure on Database in busy instances.

To make matter worse, because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54777, the size of this cache cannot be increased via Cache Management UI in Confluence versions prior to 6.7.1
h2. Expected behavior

Hibernate query cache to have default limit of *25,000*
h2. Current behavior

Hibernate query cache has a default limit of just *1000*
h2. Workaround
h3. For Confluence versions prior to 6.7.1
 # Modify the cache override file at _<shared-home>/config/cache-settings-overrides.properties_, make sure that this line exists:
{code:java}
cache.maxEntriesLocalHeap.org.hibernate.cache.internal.StandardQueryCache=25000
{code}

 # Restart Confluence

h3. For Confluence versions 6.7.1 and later
 # Access Cache Management UI at _<confluence-base-url>/admin/cache/showStatistics.action#fullView_, adjust size of _org.hibernate.cache.internal.StandardQueryCache_v5_ to be 25000.

 # Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Size of Hibernate query cache is initially set to an insufficient value in Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Description
While user A is editing a page and User B restricted the page when User A is still editing the page, Confluence will allow User A to continue to edit the page but will not allow the User A to save the page. The warning message appear is misleading.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Login Confluence with User A
# Edit a page in Confluence
# Open a new browser windows
# Login as User B
# Restrict the page that User A is editing
# Go back to the User A browser and click Save
# Confluence will show error related to the following
{quote}
Looks like your session expired. Log in again to keep working
{quote}
or
{quote}
Collaborative editing is here! That means we need a little help from you to restart your editing session. All you need to do is copy the content, edit this page again, then paste it in and save.
{quote}

Expected Result
A proper warning message is shown to the user

Actual Result
The error message is misleading.
fields.summary: Improper error messages while trying to edit a page with restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments with multibyte file name like "添付ファイル.docx" don't get hit in "Search on other pages" dialog for file/image insertion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a file with name "添付ファイル.docx" in any page and save it.
 # Create any other page.
 # Click "Insert files and images"
 # Click "Search on other pages"
 # Input "添付ファイル" in the inputbox and search.

h3. Expected Results

You can find 添付ファイル.docx attached in step 1 above.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing found in the search dialog.

!Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 14.59.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Note

The search dialog internally convert the search query for lucene to "添付ファイル*" . i.e. It adds a wildcard in the end of whole keyword. 
Apparently this makes Lucene recognize that "添付ファイル" is a single word, not a sentence.
h3. Workaround

Apparently putting wildcard in front of the keyword as "*添付ファイル" works for this case.
 Internally this raises {{LEADING_WILDCARD_NOT_ALLOWED}} , but it retries the search removing all wildcard ending up with a clean search with a keyword "添付ファイル".

!Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 15.00.35.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attachments with multibyte file name don't get hit in search dialog for file/image insertion

When the user has Confluence that integrates with JIRA 8, the user will not be able to add JIRA Event issue in the team calendar via JQL or saved filter. Team calendar will only provide the option to create JIRA event via the project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 [^Recording #52.mp4]

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to create the JIRA event via JQL or saved filter
h3. Actual Results

The user is only able to create the event via the project

Install the Jira iCalendar plugin version 1.5.0 and higher, https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/72413/jira-icalendar-plugin/version-history

With the closure of JRASERVER-68903 - iCalendar REST API returns 404 java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError, this problem is fixed if Jira is upgraded to version 8.2.0/8.1.1.

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
Bullet and number lists cannot be indented more than one level beyond the parent in the new editor. Only sequential indents are allowed. Indenting more than once was possible in the previous version of the editor. This causes a limitaitons on the page format for users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# In a Confluence page, add a bullet list
# Select the whole bullet list or an individual element
# Click on the *Indent* button on the top-bar of the editor

# Create a Confluence page
# add a bullet (or numbered item) and type some text
# add another bullet (or numbered item) and type some text
# Click the indent (to the right) button on the editor (the bullet should now be indented one level below the parent).
# Click the indent button again but nothing happens

h3. Expected Results  
* The list will be indented:
 !old_editor.gif! 

h3. Actual Results 

* No changes are seen in the editor and the bullet list remains on the left margin of the page. 
 !new_editor.gif! 

h3. Workaround 
* Only use sequential indents on page content
* Use the *Align* buttons to align the lists to the center or to the right margin of the editor page.
fields.summary: Page Bullet and Numbered Lists indent limited to one level below parent

fields.description:
With Confluence Version 6.14.1, the attachment editing feature now in the form of Atlassian Companion app still does not do a basic version check.  What this means is that if 2 people are editing the same attachment, and they both save changes without each other knowing, the person that saved their changes later will overwrite all the changes from the person that saved earlier.

The Atlassian Companion application should have access to the version number of the attachment being edited and who edited the version.  When someone tries to save back to Confluence, the Atlassian Companion app should do a version check to see if the current edited Version Number + 1 exists on the attachment.  If it doesn't, then it is safe to save back.  If a version number like that does exist, the Atlassian Companion app should tell the user they are not editing the most recent version of the document and if they save back, they will overwrite past changes done by said person or people.  Then the user can decide whether or not to save the changes.

I am sure there are more than one way to make this feature work, and I am fairly confident this feature can be accomplished without implementing anything new infrastructure wise because the REST endpoint already exists. ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-child-attachment-get)]

It would be cool if the Atlassian Companion app could also show what content changed.  But a warning at least would make the companion app much more trustworthy to use.
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion does not Version Check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Disabling "Events" event type on Team Calendars will
 * Prevent event creation from mobile CalDAV connection
 * Corrupt calendar "Events" event type
 * Create duplicate "Events" event types and actual Events for every attempt to create an event from the mobile
 * Prevent events from getting created using "Events" event type even after re-enabling the type.

h3. Environment
 * Android Mobile with CalDAV two way sync to Team Calendars
 * Confluence Team Calendars 6.0.27

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Calendar in TC
 # Create a _test_ event using built-in *Events* event type
 # Add calendar to an android mobile device using CalDAV as outlined in [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Android Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-android-calendar-946631707.html] instructions
 # Synchronize and confirm that you can see new test event in mobile calendars
 # On team calendars disable "Events" event type, _test_ event will disappear as expected.
 # Synchronize CalDAV on mobile, _test_ event will disappear on *TC* and *Mobile*
 # Attempt to create a new event on *Mobile*

h3. Expected Results
The event is created on Mobile Calendar and then syncronised to Confluence Team Calendars

h3. Actual Results
 * Test event is created on mobile, but disappears after refresh and never appears on TC
 * Re-enabling disabled *Events* event type will result in duplicate *Events* event types and events, one for each "failed" mobile event creation attempt
 !multiple event types.png|thumbnail!
 * From calendars event type we do not see any custom event types
 !no custom event type.png|thumbnail!
 * Attempting to create an event with default *Events* event type will result in {{java.lang.NullPointerException}} in WebUI and {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code:java}
2019-02-26 12:18:47,364 ERROR [http-nio-26132-exec-9] [calendar3.rest.ExceptionMappers.GeneralExceptionMapper] getResponseError General exception happen on calendar resources
 -- referer: http://confluence.com/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: 6954e3dc5f83cea0 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.addEvent(DefaultCalendarManager.java:981)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:333)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:190)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.plugin.ExportableInterceptorAdapter$WrappedMethodInvocation.proceed(ExportableInterceptorAdapter.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.spi.SpringInterceptorAdapter$SpringMethodInvocationAdapter.proceed(SpringInterceptorAdapter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.spi.SpringInterceptorAdapter.invoke(SpringInterceptorAdapter.java:23)
{code}

 * On mobile, none of the duplicates will be visible

h3. Workaround
Exporting calendar as an ical, deleting and re-importing it fixes duplicate event types and allows events creation again
fields.summary: Disabling "Events" event type breaks CalDAV synchronisation to mobile and the calendar on TC

h3. Issue Summary In Confluence pages, changing the colour of links to other Confluence pages using the color palette does not get reflected when the page is saved.  h3. Environment Issue observed on Confluence 6.14.0 onwards. Issue does not observed on Confluence 6.13.x and below h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page # Add a link of another Confluence page by: #* Directly pasting a link of another Confluence page #* Go to Insert More Content > Link > Search > Insert for any other Confluence page # Change the link color using the palette to a different color.  # In the Edit mode, the links will seem to have their color changed.  !CONFSERVER-57949-replication steps.png|thumbnail! # Publish. h3. Expected Results The links will have their color changed h3. Actual Results The link will maintain the the blue color regardless of the color that was assigned to it. h3. Notes * The issue seems to occur if a whole link has its color changed. If you attempt to change the color of part of the link. The new color will be reflected after the change.  * The issue does not affect links to outside of Confluence such as {{https://www.google.com}} h3. Workaround #1: Source Editor # Download and install the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server&tab=overview] app in your Confluence instance. # Edit the problematic page and click the *<>* button to edit its Storage Format. # You will need to adapt the piece of code for the colored links. Starting from this non-functional, green-colored link example: {code:java}

{code} # Add an {{}} tag right after the {{}} node. Also add its closing tag, {{}}. {code:java}

{code} # Inside this new tag, add a _span_ tag with the color settings on its "style" parameter. You can either copy or move the text from the existing code to the new location. Remember to also move or copy the closing tag, {{}} to the proper location. In the example below, I moved the text: {code:java}

{code} # Inside the _span_ tag, add the link text - repeat the same value of the "ri:content-title" attribute: {code:java}

page 3

{code} # Save and publish the page. h3. Workaround #2: HTML Macro # Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! > *Manage Apps* # Click the dropdown menu and select *All Apps*. # Click on "x of 8 modules enabled". # Enable the *html (html-xhtml)* module. # Go to the problematic page and insert an [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html]. # Add some HTML code inside the macro according to your needs. For example: {code:java} My hardcoded link for page 3 {code} #* (!) Note that this will be a "hardcoded" link and will not inherit some Confluence features like automatic link renaming when the page gets moved or renamed. We suggest using a [Tiny Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/the-differences-between-various-url-formats-for-a-confluence-page-278692715.html] instead of the default link. # Save the page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A bug in 6.11.0 to 6.15.2 leads to the Create Space dialog not loading, and giving an  "unknown server error" in the UI after clicking on the Create Space button.

A pre-exiting KB has almost 100% effectiveness with some exceptions that are environmental, not the application. Here's the KB:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/creating-new-page-or-space-loads-forever-744329880.html]

This was caused by the space blueprints table AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO containing a reference to a blueprint that was no longer available.
E.g. the plugin that included the blueprint has been uninstalled.

Another situation is where the blueprint was partially enabled.

This bug is fixed in 6.13.5 and 6.15.3.


h3. Logs

This is the logging by default that is used to identify the problem:
{code:java}
2019-01-23 15:19:28,291 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
  ->[PluginReadWriteTx]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT (Session #1723296075)
 -- referer: https://mywiki.com/admin/viewlog4j.action | url: /rest/create-dialog/1.0/space-blueprint/dialog/web-items | traceId: 6b739b69b3cbee0b | userName: supertest@test.com
{code}
Logs with debug on for AO:
{code:java}
2019-01-23 15:19:28,266 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "NAME","PROMOTED_BPS","PLUGIN_CLONE","CATEGORY","ID","UUID","PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" FROM "AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO"
2019-01-23 15:19:28,268 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "ID","CONTENT" FROM "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" LIMIT 1
2019-01-23 15:19:28,274 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "HOME_PAGE_ID" FROM "AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO" WHERE "ID" = ?
2019-01-23 15:19:28,276 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "ID","CONTENT" FROM "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" LIMIT 1
2019-01-23 15:19:28,277 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "HOME_PAGE_ID" FROM "AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO" WHERE "ID" = ?
2019-01-23 15:19:28,281 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "HOME_PAGE_ID" FROM "AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO" WHERE "ID" = ?
2019-01-23 15:19:28,286 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [net.java.ao.sql] onSql SELECT "UUID" FROM "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" WHERE "ID" = ?
2019-01-23 15:19:28,291 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
  ->[PluginReadWriteTx]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT (Session #1723296075)
 -- referer: https://mywiki.com/admin/viewlog4j.action | url: /rest/create-dialog/1.0/space-blueprint/dialog/web-items | traceId: 6b739b69b3cbee0b | userName: supertest@test.com
{code}
It happens on UPGRADES from 6.x to 6.11.x or later versions and it happens with all databases, no common plugin used, dropping/truncating the tables always resolve the problem, with just one exception.

h3. Steps to reproduce

There are a few ways to reproduce it.  The most common and dangerous is:
 * Create a space using the a space blueprint
 * Disable the plugin module that provides that space blueprint
 * Upgrade to 6.11.x or above
 * Try to create a space

The "it happens on upgrade" is because the bug was introduced there, and in previous versions it was fine to disable the space blueprint of a plugin module.
 * When using 6.11.x or above
 * Create a space using the a space blueprint
 * Disable the plugin module that provides that space blueprint
 * Try to create a space

Another way is to just disable a space blueprint plugin module without disabling the space blueprint item module, e.g.
 * When using 6.11.x or above
 * Go to Manage apps
 * Turn off the team-space-blueprint module
 * Try to create a space

h3. Workarounds

* Upgrade to 6.15.3 or 6.13.5
* Create spaces using the old UI.  You don't get to choose a space type, but you can still create spaces.  Start at http://<baseurl>/<contextpath>/spaces/createspace-start.action
* If you have disabled or uninstalled any space blueprint plugins or plugin modules you used to use, then re-enable them
* If those aren't enough, follow this KB to delete old space blueprint use from the database [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/creating-new-page-or-space-loads-forever-744329880.html]
fields.summary: Unable to create spaces in 6.11.x to 6.15.2 when a space blueprint plugin has been removed
